report_title: Industry Report: International Trade Financing in the US
executive_summary: The International Trade Financing industry provides an array of financial instruments to facilitate global trade while reducing the financial risk companies are often exposed to when conducting international business. Trade financing companies make funds available for businesses to cover inventory expenses and purchases of materials to maintain cash flow while awaiting payment of foreign accounts receivable. Industry revenue is earned from interest income and origination and other fees generated from sales of loans.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The International Trade Financing industry facilitates global trade by providing loan services to both financial and nonfinancial businesses.
The emergence of COVID-19 led to a global macroeconomic slowdown that impaired international trade and industry revenue.
IBISWorld estimates that industry revenue has declined an annualized 0.3% to $595.3 million over the five years to 2021.
Revenue is forecast to increase 4.2% in 2021 as global trade patterns are restored.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: IBISWorld forecasts industry revenue to increase an annualized 6.3% to $808.5 million over the five years to 2026.
The Federal Reserve is slated to increase interest rates during the outlook period, benefiting industry revenue and profit.
Operators are expected to continue experiencing strong competition from foreign banking subsidiaries.

industry_definition: This industry comprises operators primarily engaged in providing working capital funds to US exporters and lending funds to foreign buyers of US goods. Operators in this industry also lend funds to domestic buyers of imported goods.

positive_impact_factors: High and steady barriers to entry
negative_impact_factors: Low and steady industry assistance level

key_trends: International trade financing companies have been crucial in reducing the riskiness of US value chains
As international trade grows, so too has demand for working capital loans
The industry is characterized as being in the mature stage of its economic life cycle

market_segmentation.segment_description: US importers are expected to account for the largest share of industry revenue in 2021, making up 60.2% of total revenue. Importers request financing to buy goods within a range of industries, including electronics, automobile, food and beverage, apparel and textile and industrial.

US exporters are anticipated to make up a smaller share of industry revenue in 2021, at an estimated 19.9%. Similar to US importers, US exporters typically lie within the manufacturing and wholesaling sectors, and export a range of products within the industrial, transport, electronic, food and beverage and apparel industries, among others.

Foreign buyers of domestic goods are expected to account for 19.9% of industry revenue in 2021. Foreign buyers use trade financing to purchase goods from a variety of US industries to use in their manufacturing processes or to resell the goods. Demand from foreign importers often comes from developing countries, in which small- and medium-sized businesses (SMEs) would not otherwise have the capacity to finance the purchase. According to the Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council, India is anticipated to account for the largest share of trade finance claims for industry operators.

products_and_services.product_description: Loans from trade finance operators enable buyers and sellers of goods to expedite the trade process using the most efficient means of cash flow, while also limiting risk. Loans are most beneficial for small- and medium-sized enterprises that would not otherwise have the credit to import or export goods, limiting their share of potential consumers. Loans are secured by guarantees, in which industry operators guarantee that one party, often the borrower, or importer, will repay the debt to the seller, or exporter. Often, the exporter will likely request a guarantee from industry operators to ensure that, if the importer is unable to fulfill the obligations of the contract, the industry operator involved will cover the loss.
Other services provided by the industry include revolving lines of credit, letters of credit and supply chain finance, among others.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The total trade value, which measures the total value of US imports and exports, is the primary driver of demand for industry services. When downstream demand for US imports and exports or foreign imports of domestic goods is curbed, companies are less likely to demand financing for trade. Conversely, during periods of economic boom, trade is at its highest, driving demand for trade financing.

US GDP, which measures the total value of all the goods and services produced in the US economy, reflects the overall performance of the economy and is a good indicator of demand for industry services. When US GDP is low, such as during the economic downturn associated with the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic in early 2020, consumer spending falls and unemployment and economic uncertainty rise. As US consumers spend less on goods, imports to the US fall due to the lack of demand.

business_locations.location_description: The West accounts for the largest share of industry establishments, with 32.7% of establishments located in this region in 2021. California accounts for nearly all of the region's establishments, at 31.0% in 2021. California's ports of Los Angeles and Long Beach are some of the busiest in both the United States and the world, attracting many companies involved in exporting and importing.

The Mid-Atlantic region holds an estimated 23.2% of industry establishments in 2021, making it the second-largest center of industry establishments. New York accounts for most of these establishments, with 14.9% of establishments. New York provides easy access to the Port of New York and New Jersey, attracting manufacturing and trading activity.

The Southeast is the next most populated region, holding 17.9% of industry establishments in 2021. Florida accounts for the entirety of the region's establishments, at 17.9% in 2021. Manufacturing accounts for nearly 5.0% of Florida's gross state production, making it a popular hub for importers and exporters.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Operators must comply with regulations like the Bank Secrecy Act to prevent money laundering.
The industry is affected by regulations for financial institutions such as the Dodd-Frank Act which increased compliance costs.
Basel III establishes uniform liquidity and bank capital requirements for global banking operations.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Operators need significant capital to service clients, since the clients are in need of substantial and time-sensitive financing for trade.
Regulation is a significant barrier to entry for new entrants to this industry. Depending on the origin or destination country of trade, local and regional regulations differ.
Adhering to industry compliance and regulations presents a significant cost to industry operators, which can be an additional barrier to entry for new entrants.
A lack of existing clients may also pose a barrier to entry for new entrants to the market. Many established industry operators have a stable base of repeat clients.

basis_points.basis_description: Declining profit from foreign small- and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) has heightened competition among industry operators over the five years to 2021 for large clients.
Competition from external sources like technology and institutional investing is increasing, enabling importers and exporters to bypass industry operators.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top four industry operators accounted for an estimated 50.3% of industry revenue in 2021.
Market share concentration has fallen as operators have become more risk-averse, rejecting more proposals and competing for fewer large clients.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wage expenses for highly educated employees
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage expenses command a significant share of industry revenue given the service-based nature of industry operations and the general necessity for highly educated employees.
Major industry purchases include professional and technical services, communication services, data processing software, computer equipment, and other purchased computer services.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Interest expenses and loan loss provisions
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Other industry expenses include interest expenses, noninterest expenses, loan and lease loss provisions, insurance, legal costs, poor and doubtful debts, and miscellaneous costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is characterized as having a low level of capital intensity given its dependence on human capital and lack of significant capital investment required to perform essential business functions.

Industry operators are expected to spend more on capital investments in cybersecurity and other data processing services over the next five years to keep up with trends and gain an advantage over competitors.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Influenced by interest rates and global trade
volatility_points.volatility_description: Profit is generally influenced by the interest rate trends, global trade patterns, and the varying levels of competition posed by foreign banks.
Global trade has recently suffered from the widespread macroeconomic disruptions that have stemmed from the COVID-19 pandemic.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The industry has yet to digitalize significant parts of the trade financing process primarily due to the hefty regulatory and compliance tasks that require operators to physically document transactions.
Technologies such as blockchain, AI, and IoT are gaining traction due to their potential to increase efficiency, accuracy, and ease of the transaction process.

FAQs.question: How has the shift toward conducting business online affected demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: This shift toward conducting business online has made it easier for trade financing companies to advertise their services. Additionally, providing services online and through mobile apps has helped lead to some economies of scale for operators. These processes have also made banking easier for consumers at the same time. Companies that can more effectively adopt an online presence during the lengthy in-person business restrictions that have persisted during the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic are expected to outperform the average player.

FAQs.question: How diversified are your product offerings compared to competitors?
FAQs.answer: The International Trade Financing Industry is largely responsible for making loans to commercial and industrial customers to help clients fund new business plans and minimize many types of risk associated with conducting international business.

FAQs.question: Does your company have exposure to fintech competitors? How is it effecting your strategy moving forward?
FAQs.answer: The industry has experienced an increase in competition from fintech companies that use the latest software and technologies to earn business on favorable trade terms.

FAQs.question: How wide is your geographic reach? Are there any countries that you would like to extend your operations to?
FAQs.answer: Doing business with a host of nations increases a company's reputation and helps by providing businesses with access to new markets. Access to emerging markets is anticipated to drive volume and revenue growth in the future.

FAQs.question: How do you ensure that you stay up to date with software and technology trends?
FAQs.answer: The industry continues to be exposed to advanced technologies such as blockchain, artificial intelligence, and machine learning. The implementation of such technologies can enable businesses to drive efficiencies, decrease risk, win new business, and serve as a key differentiator.

FAQs.question: To what extent are your processes automated and how do you plan on investing in automation over the coming years?
FAQs.answer: Despite improvements in technology, the industry remains very labor intensive. Traditional lenders have recently experienced increased competition from fintech companies that lever online platforms to drive business.

FAQs.question: What are the most recent regulations that have impacted your operations?
FAQs.answer: The industry and its customers continue to be adversely affected by global macroeconomic shutdowns and disrupted trade flows. Nevertheless, the industry was largely designated as essential and allowed to perform critical duties throughout the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. The industry is subject to significant regulatory supervision; any breach of regulations will negatively affect company reputation and international trade volumes. The industry is expected to continue to experience steady regulation from a host of agencies and bureaus.

FAQs.question: How have you developed your internal processes? Do you have plans to develop any new processes in the future?
FAQs.answer: Sound, prudential guidelines and controls are imperative for a financial business to succeed.

FAQs.question: How do you attract and retain qualified staff? Do you have a high turnover rate?
FAQs.answer: Due to the overwhelming dependence on human capital, companies must be able to attract and retain quality staff.

FAQs.question: Has your revenue trended in line with a falling industrial production index in 2020 as facilities idled in response to social distancing measures? What strategies do you employ to create greater demand for manufactured products?
FAQs.answer: The International Trade Financing Industry predominantly makes commercial and industrial loans to non-financial businesses. Therefore, as industrial production slowed during the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, the industry was unable to connect sellers with buyers.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor total trade value? What percentage of your revenue is generated from interest and origination fees? Do you earn more revenue from importing products into the United States or exporting to foreign countries?
FAQs.answer: International trade flows have been impeded by the global coronavirus pandemic. Trade financing companies have suffered as fewer products are being sold overseas due to supply chain impediments and the general lull in macroeconomic activity. Total trade value is expected to benefit from economic derestriction over the next several years, providing a boost in demand for industry services.

FAQs.question: How have fluctuations in interest rates affected sales from your business? How does your company counteract a decrease in interest rates?
FAQs.answer: Industry revenue is earned from interest income and origination and other fees generated from sales of loans. Therefore, trade financing companies earn greater net interest income as they increase the interest rates on each loan. Recently, industry revenue and average profit have suffered as the Federal Reserve targeted lower interest rates to support the smooth flow of credit to households and businesses amid the economic catastrophe.
